description.zh-cn: 美国第28任总统，学者及政治家。作为进步主义时代的领袖，他的国内及国际政策主张被称为“威尔逊主义”。他推动了联邦储备系统、联邦贸易委员会的建立，并在第一次世界大战后期提出“十四点和平原则”，倡导建立国际联盟。
description.en: The 28th President of the United States, an academic and statesman. A leader of the Progressive Era, his domestic and international policy proposals are known as "Wilsonianism." He advanced the creation of the Federal Reserve System and the Federal Trade Commission, and proposed the "Fourteen Points" near the end of World War I, advocating for the establishment of the League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国的国家元首和政府首脑。伍德罗·威尔逊是第28任总统。
description.en: The head of state and head of government of the United States of America. Woodrow Wilson served as the 28th president.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，在伍德罗·威尔逊的两个总统任期内担任副总统。
description.en: American politician who served as the Vice President of the United States during both of Woodrow Wilson's presidential terms.

description.zh-cn: 美国第27任总统。他在1912年总统选举中作为共和党候选人参选，但其与西奥多·罗斯福的竞争导致共和党选票分裂，使得伍德罗·威尔逊当选。
description.en: The 27th President of the United States. He ran as the Republican candidate in the 1912 presidential election, but his rivalry with Theodore Roosevelt split the Republican vote, leading to Woodrow Wilson's victory.

description.zh-cn: 美国第29任总统，接替伍德罗·威尔逊。他曾释放并赦免了因反战活动被威尔逊政府判刑的尤金·V·德布斯。
description.en: The 29th President of the United States, succeeding Woodrow Wilson. He released and pardoned Eugene V. Debs, who had been imprisoned by the Wilson administration for anti-war activities.

description.zh-cn: 美国新泽西州的政府首脑。伍德罗·威尔逊在当选总统前曾担任此职。
description.en: The head of government of the U.S. state of New Jersey. Woodrow Wilson held this position before becoming president.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国新泽西州的私立研究型大学。伍德罗·威尔逊曾于1902年至1910年担任该校校长，他也是该校的校友。
description.en: A private research university in New Jersey, USA. Woodrow Wilson served as its president from 1902 to 1910 and was also an alumnus.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国马里兰州巴尔的摩的研究型大学。伍德罗·威尔逊在此获得历史与政治科学的哲学博士学位。
description.en: A research university in Baltimore, Maryland, USA. Woodrow Wilson earned his Ph.D. in history and political science here.

description.zh-cn: 美国的两大主要政党之一。伍德罗·威尔逊是民主党人，并在1912年和1916年作为该党候选人赢得总统选举。
description.en: One of the two major political parties in the United States. Woodrow Wilson was a Democrat and won the presidential elections of 1912 and 1916 as the party's candidate.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊的第一任妻子，于1914年在白宫病逝。
description.en: The first wife of Woodrow Wilson, who passed away in the White House in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊的第二任妻子。在威尔逊1919年中风后，她 фактически 管理了总统的日程和政务，被称为“第一位女总统”。
description.en: The second wife of Woodrow Wilson. After Wilson's stroke in 1919, she effectively managed the president's schedule and government affairs, earning her the title of the "first female president."

description.zh-cn: 一次关键的美国总统选举，由于共和党候选人塔夫脱和进步党候选人罗斯福之间的竞争分裂了选票，民主党候选人伍德罗·威尔逊最终获胜。
description.en: A pivotal U.S. presidential election in which Democratic candidate Woodrow Wilson won, largely due to a split in the Republican vote between incumbent William Howard Taft and former president Theodore Roosevelt, who ran on the Progressive Party ticket.

description.zh-cn: 美国第26任总统。他在1912年作为进步党候选人参选，分散了共和党选票，间接导致伍德罗·威尔逊当选。
description.en: The 26th President of the United States. He ran as the Progressive Party candidate in 1912, splitting the Republican vote and indirectly leading to Woodrow Wilson's election.

description.zh-cn: 由伍德罗·威尔逊总统签署的法案，旨在建立美国的中央银行系统——联邦储备系统，以稳定金融体系。
description.en: An act signed into law by President Woodrow Wilson that created the Federal Reserve System, the central banking system of the United States, to provide financial stability.

description.zh-cn: 美国的中央银行系统，由1913年的《联邦储备法案》创立，在伍德罗·威尔逊任内建立。
description.en: The central banking system of the United States, created by the Federal Reserve Act of 1913 and established during Woodrow Wilson's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 美国联邦政府的一个独立机构，由威尔逊总统建立，旨在通过执行反托拉斯法来促进消费者保护和消除反竞争的商业行为。
description.en: An independent agency of the U.S. federal government, established by President Wilson, with the mission of promoting consumer protection and eliminating anti-competitive business practices through the enforcement of antitrust laws.

description.zh-cn: 一种基于种族的系统性隔离政策。威尔逊政府在联邦机构中实施了种族隔离，解雇了大量黑人雇员，并受到民权团体的批评。
description.en: A systemic policy of separation based on race. The Wilson administration implemented racial segregation in federal agencies, leading to the dismissal of many Black employees and drawing criticism from civil rights groups.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的战争，是伍德罗·威尔逊第二个总统任期的核心议题。在美国保持中立失败后，威尔逊于1917年领导美国参战。
description.en: A global war that was the central issue of Woodrow Wilson's second presidential term. After a period of neutrality, Wilson led the United States into the war in 1917.

description.zh-cn: 第一次世界大战中的同盟国核心成员。其发动的无限制潜艇战和发送齐默尔曼电报等行为，最终促使美国对德宣战。
description.en: A central member of the Central Powers in World War I. Its actions, including unrestricted submarine warfare and the Zimmermann Telegram, ultimately prompted the United States to declare war on it.

description.zh-cn: 1917年德国外交秘书阿图尔·齐默尔曼发给墨西哥的一份加密电报，提议德墨结盟对抗美国。该电报被截获和解密后，成为美国参加一战的重要推手。
description.en: A secret diplomatic communication issued from the German Foreign Office in January 1917 that proposed a military alliance between Germany and Mexico in the event of the United States entering World War I against Germany. Its interception and decryption were a major factor in the U.S. decision to enter the war.

description.zh-cn: 德国在第一次世界大战期间采取的潜艇战术，即不经警告就攻击任何驶往敌对国港口的商船。这一政策是美国参战的主要原因之一。
description.en: A type of naval warfare in which submarines sink merchant ships without warning, as opposed to attacks per prize rules. Germany's adoption of this policy during World War I was a primary reason for the U.S. entry into the war.

description.zh-cn: 由伍德罗·威尔逊总统在一次演讲中提出的关于结束一战和重建战后世界秩序的原则声明。它成为凡尔赛条约和建立国际联盟的基础。
description.en: A statement of principles for peace that was to be used for peace negotiations in order to end World War I, outlined in a January 8, 1918 speech by President Woodrow Wilson. It became the basis for the Treaty of Versailles and the creation of the League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: 第一次世界大战后成立的第一个全球性国际组织，旨在维护世界和平。该组织的创建是威尔逊“十四点原则”的核心内容，但他未能说服美国国会批准加入。
description.en: The first worldwide intergovernmental organisation whose principal mission was to maintain world peace, founded after World War I. Its creation was a central plank of Wilson's Fourteen Points, but he was unable to persuade the U.S. Congress to ratify American membership.

description.zh-cn: 正式结束第一次世界大战的和平条约。伍德罗·威尔逊在谈判中发挥了主导作用，并将建立国际联盟的内容写入了条约。
description.en: The peace treaty that brought World War I to an end. Woodrow Wilson played a leading role in its negotiation and incorporated the creation of the League of Nations into the treaty.

description.zh-cn: 一种急性脑血管疾病。1919年10月，威尔逊总统经历了一次严重的中风，导致他身体部分瘫痪，严重影响了他履行总统职责的能力。
description.en: An acute cerebrovascular disease. In October 1919, President Wilson suffered a severe stroke that left him partially paralyzed and seriously impaired his ability to perform presidential duties.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，三届民主党总统候选人。他在1912年民主党大会上支持威尔逊获得提名，并被任命为国务卿。后因坚持和平主义立场而辞职。
description.en: An American politician and three-time Democratic presidential nominee. He supported Wilson for the nomination at the 1912 Democratic convention and was appointed Secretary of State, later resigning due to his pacifist stance.

description.zh-cn: 美国共和党参议员，威尔逊总统在外交政策上的主要政治对手。他领导了反对美国加入国际联盟的斗争，并最终成功阻止了《凡尔赛条约》在美国参议院的批准。
description.en: A Republican U.S. Senator and President Wilson's chief political adversary on foreign policy. He led the fight against U.S. membership in the League of Nations, ultimately succeeding in blocking the Senate's ratification of the Treaty of Versailles.

description.zh-cn: 美国的立法机构。在伍德罗·威尔逊的请求下，国会于1917年4月对德宣战。战后，由共和党控制的参议院拒绝批准《凡尔赛条约》，使美国未能加入国际联盟。
description.en: The legislature of the United States. At Woodrow Wilson's request, Congress declared war on Germany in April 1917. After the war, the Republican-controlled Senate refused to ratify the Treaty of Versailles, preventing the U.S. from joining the League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊担任第28任总统的国家。在他的领导下，美国参加了第一次世界大战。
description.en: The country where Woodrow Wilson served as the 28th president. Under his leadership, the United States entered World War I.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国弗吉尼亚州的城市，是伍德罗·威尔逊的出生地。
description.en: A city in the U.S. state of Virginia, and the birthplace of Woodrow Wilson.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊于1913年至1921年担任美国第28任总统。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson served as the 28th President of the United States from 1913 to 1921.

description.zh-cn: 在当选总统前，伍德罗·威尔逊曾担任新泽西州州长。
description.en: Before being elected president, Woodrow Wilson served as the Governor of New Jersey.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊曾担任普林斯顿大学校长，期间推行了一系列教育改革。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson served as the President of Princeton University, where he implemented a series of educational reforms.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊于1879年毕业于普林斯顿大学。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson graduated from Princeton University in 1879.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊于1886年在约翰·霍普金斯大学获得历史与政治科学的哲学博士学位。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson received his Ph.D. in history and political science from Johns Hopkins University in 1886.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊是民主党党员，并代表该党赢得了两次总统选举。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson was a member of the Democratic Party and won two presidential elections as its candidate.

description.zh-cn: 托马斯·R·马歇尔在威尔逊的两个总统任期内担任副总统。
description.en: Thomas R. Marshall served as Vice President during both of Wilson's presidential terms.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊于1885年与爱伦·艾克森结婚，直至她1914年去世。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson was married to Ellen Axson from 1885 until her death in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 在第一任妻子去世后，伍德罗·威尔逊于1915年与伊迪丝·柏林结婚。
description.en: Following the death of his first wife, Woodrow Wilson married Edith Bolling in 1915.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊出生于弗吉尼亚州斯汤顿。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson was born in Staunton, Virginia.

description.zh-cn: 由于共和党选票被塔夫脱和罗斯福分散，伍德罗·威尔逊赢得了1912年总统选举。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson won the 1912 presidential election due to the split in the Republican vote between Taft and Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 在1912年总统选举中，西奥多·罗斯福作为第三方候选人参选，分散了共和党选票，从而阻碍了时任总统威廉·霍华德·塔夫脱的连任。
description.en: In the 1912 presidential election, Theodore Roosevelt ran as a third-party candidate, splitting the Republican vote and thereby blocking the re-election of incumbent President William Howard Taft.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊总统支持并通过了《联邦储备法案》，建立了美国的中央银行系统。
description.en: President Wilson supported and passed the Federal Reserve Act, establishing the central banking system of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 《联邦储备法案》的通过直接促成了联邦储备系统的建立。
description.en: The passage of the Federal Reserve Act directly led to the establishment of the Federal Reserve System.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊总统建立了联邦贸易委员会，以阻止不公平的交易行为并鼓励竞争。
description.en: President Wilson established the Federal Trade Commission to prevent unfair business practices and encourage competition.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊总统支持其内阁在联邦政府机构中实施种族隔离政策，导致大量黑人雇员被解职或隔离。
description.en: President Wilson supported his cabinet in implementing racial segregation policies within federal government agencies, leading to the dismissal or segregation of many Black employees.

description.zh-cn: 德国发动的无限制潜艇战以及发送旨在拉拢墨西哥的“齐默尔曼电报”，促使威尔逊总统请求国会对德宣战。
description.en: Germany's unrestricted submarine warfare and the "Zimmermann Telegram" aimed at recruiting Mexico as an ally prompted President Wilson to ask Congress to declare war.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊于1917年4月向国会发表演说，成功说服国会对德宣战，使美国加入第一次世界大战。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson delivered a speech to Congress in April 1917, successfully persuading it to declare war on Germany and leading the United States into World War I.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊总统发表了“十四点和平原则”，阐述了他对战后世界秩序的设想，主张建立国际联盟。
description.en: President Wilson delivered the "Fourteen Points," outlining his vision for a postwar world order and advocating for the creation of a League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: “十四点和平原则”的第十四点明确提出建立一个国际联合机构，直接推动了国际联盟的创建。
description.en: The fourteenth point of the "Fourteen Points" explicitly called for the formation of an association of nations, directly pushing for the creation of the League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊是建立国际联盟的主要倡导者，并在巴黎和会上力主将其写入《凡尔赛条约》。
description.en: Wilson was the primary advocate for the League of Nations and championed its inclusion in the Treaty of Versailles at the Paris Peace Conference.

description.zh-cn: 参议员亨利·加博·洛吉领导了反对美国加入国际联盟的运动，最终导致《凡尔赛条约》未获批准。
description.en: Senator Henry Cabot Lodge led the opposition against U.S. entry into the League of Nations, which ultimately resulted in the failure to ratify the Treaty of Versailles.

description.zh-cn: 由于威尔逊拒绝与共和党控制的参议院妥协，美国参议院最终未能批准《凡尔赛条约》，从而阻止了美国加入国际联盟。
description.en: Due to Wilson's refusal to compromise with the Republican-controlled Senate, the U.S. Senate failed to ratify the Treaty of Versailles, thus blocking the United States from joining the League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: 1919年10月的一次严重中风使威尔逊总统身体部分瘫痪，严重削弱了他履行总统职责的能力，也影响了他为推动美国加入国联所做的努力。
description.en: A severe stroke in October 1919 left President Wilson partially paralyzed, severely weakening his ability to perform his presidential duties and affecting his efforts to promote U.S. membership in the League of Nations.

description.zh-cn: 威廉·詹宁斯·布莱恩在威尔逊的第一任期内担任国务卿，后因在战争问题上与总统意见不合而辞职。
description.en: William Jennings Bryan served as Secretary of State during Wilson's first term, but resigned due to disagreements with the president over policy regarding the war.
